item.title: Coding Fusion!
item.description: R and Python: 2 Worlds Collide I realize that the title and subtitle for this page may make it seem like we are gonna do something insanely cool, but it will just be a quick demonstration with some simple reticulate shenanigans. Let’s start with out first component: R. Below you’ll see me load up the reticulate package and save a variable as “Da”. library(reticulate) Da<-"LESSS" Now for our second component: Python.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
